tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    sensor_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    sensor_type TEXT,
    sensor_value FLOAT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Sensors (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
    reading DECIMAL,
    reading_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE Devices (
    device_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE SensorLogs (
    log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    reading DECIMAL,
    reading_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE sensors (
  sensor_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  device_id INT NOT NULL,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  value FLOAT NOT NULL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE analyses (
  analysis_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  analysis_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  sensor_id INT NOT NULL,
  result VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE sensors (sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY, sensor_name VARCHAR(50), location VARCHAR(100), sensor_type VARCHAR(50), last_reading TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE readings (reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY, sensor_id INT, value DOUBLE PRECISION, reading_time TIMESTAMP, FOREIGN KEY(sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id));
CREATE TABLE devices (device_id INT PRIMARY KEY, device_name VARCHAR(50), device_type VARCHAR(50), location VARCHAR(100));
CREATE TABLE locations (location_id INT PRIMARY KEY, location_name VARCHAR(100), latitude DOUBLE PRECISION, longitude DOUBLE PRECISION);
CREATE TABLE alerts (alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY, sensor_id INT, alert_type VARCHAR(50), alert_time TIMESTAMP, FOREIGN KEY(sensor_id) REFERENCES sensors(sensor_id));
